content.rendered:
United Kingdom division

Gilles Godard, born in 1968, Gilles Godard holds engineering degrees from the Ecole Polytechnique and the Ecole Nationale des Ponts and Chaussées and is a qualified architect. He began his career at the French Ministry of Infrastructure before becoming CEO of SYTRAL, the organisation in charge of the Greater Lyon transport network.

In 2007 he joined the AECOM Group in London, where he developed advisory services for financiers on infrastructure asset transactions. In 2009 Gilles Godard joined VINCI Concessions, serving as CEO of Olympia Odos, the company in charge of the Athens – Corinth – Patras motorway concession, then under construction. In 2014 he was appointed project director for construction of the High-Speed Rail Line between Tours and Bordeaux.

In 2016 Gilles Godard was appointed Chairman of VINCI Construction International Network.

As of February 2021, Gilles Godard heads the United Kingdom division within the VINCI Construction pole.

excerpt.rendered: As of February 2021, Gilles Godard heads the United Kingdom division within the VINCI Construction pole.
